definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: They are marching off to gyms and discovering face cream in record numbers.
sentences.chinese: 他们向健身房进军，物色到的面霜数目已创历史新高。

sentences.english: Feng's high-profile in entertainment industry is bound to bring into broad controversy.
sentences.chinese: 凤姐此次高调进军演艺界势必会带来争议。

sentences.english: In 2010 Wellhope will surely develop further in the dynamic agricultural market.
sentences.chinese: 2010年，禾丰将全力进军农产品市场。

sentences.english: The soldiers marched to the capital of the enemy country.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们向敌军的首都进军。

sentences.english: This campaign would be known as Sherman's March to the Sea.
sentences.chinese: 这次战役就是著名的“谢尔曼向海洋进军”。

sentences.english: He marched into southern France, which was then called Gaul.
sentences.chinese: 他进军到当时称为高卢的法国南部。

sentences.english: With girl change as handsome, toward become idols march.
sentences.chinese: 以少女变身为帅男，朝成为偶像进军。

sentences.english: Then we generalized the strenth of China in connecting with the international supply chain.
sentences.chinese: 建立国际化供应链成为他们向国际化进军的必然选择。

sentences.english: 'We need to be in the tablet business, ' Ms. Whitman added.
sentences.chinese: 惠特曼补充说，我们需要进军平板电脑业务。

sentences.english: Geely Chairman Li Shufu's international ambitions would be enhanced.
sentences.chinese: 吉利董事长李书福进军国际的雄心也会更进一步。

sentences.english: The sales manager recently in power itched to hxdye a go at the East Asian market.
sentences.chinese: 新上任的销售经理跃跃欲试，要进军东亚市场。

sentences.english: Hasdrubal re-formed his forces and moved into Italy.
sentences.chinese: 哈斯德鲁巴重整了他的军队，然后向意大利进军。

sentences.english: Bayin Naung was appointed commander-in-chief of the invading army in AD 1547.
sentences.chinese: 公元1547年，勃应囊被任命为进军泰国的总指挥。

sentences.english: Yet Israel did not burn any of the cities built on their mounds-except Hazor, which Joshua burned.
sentences.chinese: 在进军迦南的战役中，以色列人为甚么将夏琐焚烧？

sentences.english: Soon after, British and French forces marched on Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 不久之后，英法联军向北京进军。

sentences.english: Fubon also has plans to take on the Chinese insurance market.
sentences.chinese: 富邦更打算进军中国保险市场。

definition: to fight in one place after another
to set foot in/to step into/to become involved for the first time
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
